## Description {#details}

This file defines the AMDGPUCustomBehaviour class which inherits from CustomBehaviour.

This class is used by the tool llvm-mca to enforce target specific behaviour that is not expressed well enough in the scheduling model for mca to enforce it automatically.

## File Listing

<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/amdgpucustombehaviour"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/amdgpucustombehaviour/#a8c616a0039f36b38c197da02e179797b">AMDGPUCustomBehaviour</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#ad9c2ca3f16c7d9d1c6cd4a20269ba729">CustomBehaviour</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Whenever MCA would like to dispatch an s&#95;waitcnt instructions,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// we must check all the instruction that are still executing to see if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// they modify the same CNT as we need to wait for. This vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// gets built in the constructor and contains 1 WaitCntInfo struct</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for each instruction within the SrcManager. Each element</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// tells us which CNTs that instruction may interact with.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// We conservatively assume some instructions interact with more</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CNTs than they do in reality, so we will occasionally wait</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// longer than necessary, but we shouldn&#39;t ever wait for shorter.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;WaitCntInfo&gt; InstrWaitCntInfo;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method gets called from the constructor and is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// where we setup the InstrWaitCntInfo vector.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The core logic for determining which CNTs an instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// interacts with is taken from SIInsertWaitcnts::updateEventWaitcntAfter().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Unfortunately, some of the logic from that function is not available to us</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in this scope so we conservatively end up assuming that some</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions interact with more CNTs than they do in reality.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> generateWaitCntInfo();</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Helper function used in generateWaitCntInfo()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> hasModifiersSet(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;Instruction&gt; &amp;Inst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="normal">                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/opname">OpName</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Helper function used in generateWaitCntInfo()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Helper function used in generateWaitCntInfo()</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method gets called from checkCustomHazard when mca is attempting to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// dispatch an s&#95;waitcnt instruction (or one of its variants). The method</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// looks at each of the instructions that are still executing in the pipeline</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to determine if the waitcnt should force a wait.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> handleWaitCnt(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;InstRef&gt;</a> IssuedInst, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>);</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Based on the type of s&#95;waitcnt instruction we are looking at, and what its</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operands are, this method will set the values for each of the cnt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// references provided as arguments.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> computeWaitCnt(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Vmcnt, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &amp;Expcnt,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method is used to determine if an instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// should be allowed to be dispatched. The return value is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// how many cycles until the instruction can be dispatched.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This method is called after MCA has already checked for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// register and hardware dependencies so this method should only</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implement custom behaviour and dependencies that are not picked up</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// by MCA naturally.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/amdgpucustombehaviour/#a17cb5a2e79bf568a343e0beb4176cbec">checkCustomHazard</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;InstRef&gt;</a> IssuedInst,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><Highlight kind="normal">                             </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/instref">InstRef</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/legalizer-cpp/#a05ab4853f7153e537774d02580e761ec">IR</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">override</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
